website_summaries.verdict: An edgy game that's fun to play with a group of friends, though it might not be the best choice for family night.
pros: An updated version of a popular party game
More than 150 new cards for hours of hilarious – sometimes risque – fun
cons: Doesn't require same type of strategy or skill that some users prefer in board games

website_summaries.verdict: Arguably one of the best adult board games on the market, this is great for those with a love for twisted humor.
pros: Comes with 100 black cards, which offer fill-in-the-blank spaces for topics
The game also arrives with more than 500 white cards, which often have crude and morbid messages to match the fill-in-the-blank black card
cons: Customers wish the game  came with more cards, but there are many expanded decks for additional purchase

customer_reviews.title: LORD HAVE MERCY ON US!
customer_reviews.text: Is this what the world has come to?! Utterly banal and filthy. My adult son ordered this game. He has free will, but I let my feelings be known. I cry for our human race; for our children.
customer_reviews.author: reba505

customer_reviews.title: If you have an ounce of class, you will not like this "game"
customer_reviews.text: If you are 18 and drunk, this game is for you, otherwise, stay clear. I found the cards distasteful, embarrassing, and totally classless. I'm shocked and disgusted that so many people gave it high marks. I bought it for a 22 yr. old who felt violated when she read some of the cards. I really messed up buying it as a gift!
customer_reviews.author: JJ on Amazon

customer_reviews.title: vulgar obsene x-rated
customer_reviews.text: a 13 yr old meth head might think it is funny, I just cringed and didn't laugh much.
customer_reviews.author: dare

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Too much for a family game. Didn't realize how across the line it would be!
customer_reviews.author: Gam Gam Family

customer_reviews.title: If you are looking for wholesome entertainment, keep looking.
customer_reviews.text: With five stars and over 30,000 reviews I thought we had a hit. It was a bust. Definitely NOT what I thought it would be. I hadn't bothered to actually read the reviews. I know, rookie mistake. In order to play this game we would have had to edit a good percentage of the response cards due to vulgarity and inappropriateness. Of course, the box does specifically say it is a game for horrible people. But that was a joke, right? Thanks Amazon, for having a generous return policy. We'll stick with What Do You Meme?, Jack Box, and Exploding Kittens.
customer_reviews.author: Lita A.

customer_reviews.title: Totally inappropriate
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I recommend to do with this game is throw it in the trash where it belongs. It should be XX rated. The sexual innuendos go too far, sexual abuse, beastiality, unheathy sex and much more. My family loves board games but when we gave this a try we all reacted with thumbs down. Should only be sold in adult book store.
customer_reviews.author: L Koch

customer_reviews.title: I thought this would be better
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews, and I heard people say this was so fun. The group of people I wanted to use this with includes two teens. One of the reviews said they took out the cards that referred to God---one was"the blood of Christ"--2 referred to Jews in an antisemitic way, the rest were about sex mostly. Well the idea is a great one but the authors must get their heads out of the can. I decided to through it away
customer_reviews.author: N. Saenz

customer_reviews.title: Got this for my birthday
customer_reviews.text: I put 1 star because I have no friends to play with
customer_reviews.author: lee

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculously Obscene
customer_reviews.text: This game is so extreme in its obscenities it is a joke. I cannot fathom playing this game with family or even close friends. It is completely embarrassing and certainly not fun. I think the target market for this game is someone who is stoned or drunk and under 25 years old. I will proudly use this game to start a campfire this summer.
customer_reviews.author: Zig

customer_reviews.title: Used game sent
customer_reviews.text: Game was open before I got to open it isn't this a new game? I am super pissed now.
customer_reviews.author: Lennita Kumar Mathura

customer_reviews.title: Very Fun, Very Inapropriate
customer_reviews.text: As a 22 year old, I love this game. I have had it for a few years and still enjoy breaking it out with my friends. However, KNOW YOUR GROUP. I would not recommend playing it with your conservative elders or children. Many mature themes and words are used. I enjoy the game best with friends or family in my generation. I have bought a few expansion packs as well. They are great for when you have played multiple times and have seen all the cards more than once. I recommend buying the original game to start and adding expansions to keep it fresh after multiple plays.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson L.

customer_reviews.title: Oh the Humanity - Cards Against Humanity That Is
customer_reviews.text: Leave your inhabitions at the door. This game is fun, entertaining and you may discover things about your family and freinds you didn't know before. Cards Against Humanity is a quick paced interactive game inducing tears of laughter throughout. Caution though, Don't play this game with Prudes or, anyone who is easily embarassed saying naughty words let alone thinking them. Although, I can imagine there might be a group of Nuns who would see the entertainment value in this game. Set aside several hours to get the full affect for this game, Cold Nights, Rainy Days are perfect! Most of all - Have Fun!
customer_reviews.author: David Galuhn

customer_reviews.title: Gross
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize the cards were a set up to generate gross responses. Crude. Sophomoric.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Misleading description
customer_reviews.text: Offensive. Inmoral. Description does not say anything about the topics and/or language used in this game. Misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Ximena A. Railey

customer_reviews.title: I don't like this game at all.
customer_reviews.text: It is quite raunchy and even my 30yr old son pulls a lot of the cards out of the deck before he plays. I am not a PC fanatic but there are lines.
customer_reviews.author: James V.

customer_reviews.title: Content
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a family night game. Boy was I surprised when I read a few of the cards! Talking about masturbating with my grandchildren at Christmas time is too disgusting for us!!! Should be a better description of game.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon W.

customer_reviews.title: A little over the top...
customer_reviews.text: This game is like if "sophomoric, crass humor" was at a party. I like silly, foolish humor just as much as the next person but this is a bit much. After the first few rounds, it gets a little redundant and I stated to think to myself, why am I playing this game... It's just too much! I find that it helps to have had a few drinks before you start playing but after a while, even cocktails does not mask the crude comments that come with the territory. Meh...
customer_reviews.author: H. A. Byrd

customer_reviews.title: Game w/ Vulgar Adult Sexual Content
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked at how obscene and vulgar the cards are. There should be a warning about XXX rated content. Please know that I am very open minded and liberal but this game made me uncomfortable and cringe at times. This game is not for families and especially not for anyone under 18. I am almost 40 and attempted to play this game with my mother, husband, aunt, and over 35 years of age friends and we quickly had to find another game to play. I would like to return it as I will never play it again. Zero stars should be an option. Researching the return policy next.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Disgusting
customer_reviews.text: I knew this may have some “iffy” content but I didn’t think it would be disgusting
customer_reviews.author: Just me

customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a party. It was so vulgar I sold it.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda Carey

customer_reviews.title: I’m good
customer_reviews.text: Just too try hard there’s rarely funny combination and more three cards they found the most shocking/racist/random xD
customer_reviews.author: Charmaine

customer_reviews.title: Offensive, hardly funny
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not for children, teenagers, or adults that don't want to read about x-rated activity.
customer_reviews.author: Russell

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Not fit for children or conservative, godly people. We returned it. We listed dozens of reasons for the return. The supplier/amazon provide a refund of our money.
customer_reviews.author: Clarice Kirksey

customer_reviews.title: Disgusting game. Graphic. Sickening
customer_reviews.text: Disgusting game. Graphic. Sickening the lack of integrity this game has for life and all that is good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Under average for non Americans/Brits
customer_reviews.text: Nice party game, but card contents are mainly based on American/British Culture and unless you are too familiar with that you spend half the game time on Google. Even after you are confused whether other players (especially Card Czar) gets your point and you miss some opportunities to match cards. Despite there are 250 cards in a deck, after playing 3 or 4 times it becomes boring. Overall 4 stars for Americans/Brits, 2 stars for foreigners.
customer_reviews.author: Erekle

customer_reviews.title: Too profound.
customer_reviews.text: Though I was aware this game was a bit ‘risky’, I didn’t care for it’s bold profanity. Just too offensive for my taste.
customer_reviews.author: Di

customer_reviews.title: Meh, not impressed
customer_reviews.text: It was okay I guess, but too vulgar to be fun. The combinations can be funny sometimes but I guess I'm just not crass enough to really enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: Goes too far in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: Ok.....so we had fun playing this with 12 adults who are not easily offended. It was good for a ton of laughs. Definitely not something to play around kids. The raunchiest cards especially of a sexual nature were hilarious, the dirtier the better in my opinion, but what I wasn’t expecting was cards about race. Some of the cards like “a black person” or “a Mexican” made me uncomfortable knowing some of my guests and dearest friends playing are Mexican or black. I’m not a prude, nor my friends and they rolled with it. I’m far from uptight, but this made me uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: MissMoiMoi

customer_reviews.title: What a Dumb game !!!
customer_reviews.text: I am not one to be upset by fault language; but this game is just plain stupid and not funny for most the time... Applause to the inventor for making money from this sh*^...
customer_reviews.author: Dan Legum

customer_reviews.title: You got to be close...
customer_reviews.text: You have to play with people you know well, or strongly suspect are just as horrible inside as you are! The card combinations that turn up are filled with animal cruelty, child abuse, elder abuse; they are sexist, racist, really any kind of -ist you can think of, homophobic, xenophobic, any kind of -ic you can think of. Anti- religion, Anti-God. ANTI HUMANITY! ANTI EVERYTHING! Except... for a hilarious good time! P.S. it's for adults only, I would never play with my 17-19 yr old teenage relatives, they don't need to know who we all really are....bwahaaaaaaaa!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Lippincott

customer_reviews.title: Could be funnier!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a prude and really expected this to be hilarious. Some cards were; however the majority, in my opinion, were just plain mean!
customer_reviews.author: jack of many trades

customer_reviews.title: I bought it as a gift for my roommate and it's FUN... but still need to google some of the answers to understand the background
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as a gift for my roommate and it's FUN... but still need to google some of the answers to understand the background meanings lol
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What's not to love?
customer_reviews.text: Every time I get together with a group, especially during the holidays, we bring out Cards Against Humanity. It's always a hit! Even with 70+ year olds! I was shocked! They got into it and had GREAT answers. Everyone loves it. Always a crowd pleaser. And there are, of course, running CAH jokes... "Remember that time..." Guaranteed fun time. And if you get tired of this pack (though it's unlikely unless you play ALL THE TIME), there are different versions you can purchase to keep it fresh.
customer_reviews.author: The Bull

customer_reviews.title: Buy it or don’t, it’s your money
customer_reviews.text: This was a fun game to play with friends or at parties the first several times it was played, but unfortunately it grows stale as the same combinations become repetitive. To resolve this you can buy expansion packs, so many expansion packs you don’t need any other games. In fact you don’t need anything else at all ... except more expansion packs. Get some for your friends, your family, and your dog. Better yet, replace your friends, family, and dog with expansion packs. Then, buy your expansion packs some expansion packs and live alone in a world of cards against humanity.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: A true classic
customer_reviews.text: CAH is a classic game that everyone should appreciate. As you've read, the game is to be enjoyed with a crowd that's open minded and can laugh at inappropriate subject matters. I've purchased several of these sets for new home owners to help them create fun memories with friends in their new space - this game certainly provides ample material!
customer_reviews.author: AMG de Wet

customer_reviews.title: Not appropriate for family night!
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn’t recommend this product. We found the questions offensive. I bought it for my husband and I to play with another couple from our church. Yikes! Wish I had investigated this more before purchasing. I would’ve preferred a PG rated version.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: One of the Most Fun Adult Games
customer_reviews.text: As long as you are playing with people that you know that won't be offended by anything that may come up in the cards, this game is great. There are several times during a game that you will laugh until you nearly cry. The only negative is that some overly sensitive people may have some issues with statements on cards. This is an adult only game.
customer_reviews.author: Jody D.

customer_reviews.title: Are you an adult? Do you love to laugh with your friends? Then just buy this.
customer_reviews.text: The best party game for adults.... ever....... If you have ever played the much tamer Apples to Apples, you already know what to expect. People get cards with outlandish actions, people, or things and use them to fill in the blanks on otherwise innocent questions to produce some very nc17 results. And that's pretty much it. Competition never gets too high. Infact, some games, you will probably find yourself hoping no one wins because you just want the laughs to keep coming. The laughs come frequent and fast, and it's got a ton of expansions to keep the game from feeling old.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan C Woolery

customer_reviews.title: Dirty sense of humor
customer_reviews.text: Depending on the humor of the individual your giving this to I wouldn’t recommend giving it to just anyone. Their is some “raunchy” cards that WILL NOT be appropriate for young kids. If someone can’t take a joke DEFINITELY don’t play with them. I got this on a Black Friday deal and so happy I did. We always have our annual taco Christmas party and play games (which typically I’m in charge of) this year I decided to bring this. We have a few people in our family that are always quite, but playing this game really helped them out of their shell. Fun game and fun time.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: NOT for the Faint of Heart
customer_reviews.text: Okay, to be clear, I find this game kinda funny in a dark sort of way... but my husband thinks it's too off color to be fun. My teenage son and older daughter find it hilarious. So it's really a matter of opinion. I recommend it if you are pretty open minded and don't mind a lot of off color jokes and references. If you can recognize it's JUST a game; a game that can make you blush, cringe, and wince- all while snickering in a guilty fashion, you'll be fine. NOT for the faint of heart or sober adults. I don't recommend it as a gift though, unless you know the person really well, or like shocking people :)
customer_reviews.author: AmazonMags

customer_reviews.title: great for non hobby board gamers who want to play board games/card games.
customer_reviews.text: i personally like the game only because my family members love it. i would prefer to play more competitive games. I rate it 4 because sometimes this is the only way to get the family together at the table for a game night. this is the 2.0 which we had the 1.4 and just went through all the cards that were not in the 2.0 and took them out and gifted the 1.4 to a family member. there is a excel spreadsheet online that tells you all the cards in every expansion and re release which we used to do this process and it only took an hour to find the 100+ cards that were replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Larry

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not for serious or easily offended people
customer_reviews.text: This game is hilarious. I first played it at a bachelorette party. Although this game greatly offended some people and made them very upset, it brought many, many drunken laughs from the rest of us. I have since played it sober with my family! Definitely not for serious or easily offended people. If you worry about being polite, politically correct, or appropriate, do not buy this game! However, It is definitely fun when you are looking for something stupid and raunchy. I just bought this game for my boyfriend as a Christmas gift. I know he will love it!
customer_reviews.author: autumn24

customer_reviews.title: Skip it.
customer_reviews.text: Every now and then you get a 'funny combo' to play, but for the most part its stupid. Think Apples to Apples, but trying WAY too hard, and ultimately the cards are harder to 'combine' because they're more bespoke than Apples to Apples. And the 'adult humor' they tried to add just makes it worse, it doesn't come off as 'funny', it comes off as....well, more stupid than without it. Don't bother.
customer_reviews.author: The Mushroom Alchemist

customer_reviews.title: I bought the hype of this
customer_reviews.text: The game don’t make any sense it was a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Sal Oliva

customer_reviews.title: The Best Adult Night Game with friends... short Grand Larceny.
customer_reviews.text: This crisp black box of amazing arrived just in time for our usual Game Night with friends. We middle aged individuals sure do like our game night, and this one did not disappoint! No parcheezy for this crowd, a bottle of wine in and we were amiably arguing whether or not Daniel Radcliffs Delicious A22h0le was a more appropriate wedding gift than German Chancellor Angela Markel. 10/10! BONUS! They sell tailor made game packs to add to the fun, may I recommend the Absurd Pack, and the Period Pack (the packaging was a thing of glory)
customer_reviews.author: Mad Momma Mimm

customer_reviews.title: Made the mistake of playing with our older Children. Yikes!
customer_reviews.text: Funny game. First and foremost. Fun to play and it will make you see people in a totally different light after making it through just one round of this game. The card sayings are raunchy at times and sick, in a frat guy kinda way. Then other times they are deep. Kinda all over the place but I guess that’s how we think anyway so kinda see the correlation. But man we played it with our kids and we probably shouldn’t have. The card topics got a little uncomfortable but it was a blast. Don’t play this game with anyone younger than 18 and try not to play with your parents or kids. Good game though.
customer_reviews.author: Dale Candelaria

customer_reviews.title: Not Interesting
customer_reviews.text: After two rounds the six of us looked at each other and agreed to gift it to our teen age grand children. Not so much offensive as some reviewers have said, just not challenging or fun no matter how many glasses of wine. Suggest 'Scrupples' but make sure you have forgiving personalities involved.
customer_reviews.author: monty

customer_reviews.title: Cards Against Humanity and Decency
customer_reviews.text: I think it is pretty disgusting. I'm not a prude but it goes too far. It is also political which I didn't know, otherwise I wouldn't have bought it. I plan on returning it ASAP.
customer_reviews.author: Daphne Thabet

customer_reviews.title: If you’re offended easily, not the game for you
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this game!! I hear about it for a while before actually purchasing. I finally bought it and I’m mad at myself for not doing it sooner. We’ve purchased the red and blue box extensions. This game is a family favorite. If you don’t have a good sense of humor. If you’re easily offended. If you’re uptight. You probably won’t like this game. BUT if you like down, dirty, hilarious fun, this game will be just right. This is for mature audiences only so it’s not kid friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Jessika

customer_reviews.title: Funniest Game on Earth
customer_reviews.text: Just ignore the negative reviews. Only SJW’s and snowflakes and liberal college students might be offended. The rest of adults—-the 85% normal ones—will find this game to be incredibly funny. We had a group of 8 playing this for over 2 hours, and I’ve never seen people laughing so hard.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jensen

customer_reviews.title: It's so wrong...yet so right
customer_reviews.text: Funny? Yes Inappropriate? Yes Fun to play with your prudish mother who hesitates every time she reads a card? Ohhhhhh yeaaaaa... It is important to note that the creators of this game will allow you to print all their cards FOR FREE via their website, however who had the time for that? Take into account the cost of toner and that they won't have that 'card-like' feel to them and, well, you might decide that it's worth paying the folks who created the game. And it is totally worth it! Nothing says cheap like rolling out the faux-Cards Against Humanity. Pay for the set(s) and they'll use that to continue creating horrible updates for us horrible people.
customer_reviews.author: M. Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Vulgar and distasteful.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely disgusting. I am by far not a prude, but this game is just vulgar and distasteful. If you have at least a little class, this game isn't for you. I thought there might be cuss words in it or some little inappropriate words, but this game makes adult movie stars flush. I am not a Christian and I find it repulsive.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy K.

customer_reviews.title: Newer Decks are Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Newer edition is unfunny cringe. We played this several years back with some friends and loved it; however, the deck we recently bought (BF 2019) is horrible. Half the cards are obnoxious, over the top cringe that were seemingly wrote by an angsty liberal arts student (full of woke, or uncreative perverse material). We are going to try and return this box of garbage if possible. HEED OUR WARNING: if you played this a while back, it HAS changed and is garbage now.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Box may be damaged when you get it
customer_reviews.text: The black box the cards come in was a little damaged when I first opened my package (which seems odd because the item is supposed to be new). Otherwise, the order is as described. 550 cards of inappropriateness that will let me look forward to some interesting nights with my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: How to tell how terrible you actually are... with your terrible friends!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun social game for friends typically played while consuming adult beverages. Not for people with no sense of humor. If you win you can claim to be a terrible person, apparently like me, winning way too many times with drastically different groups of people... :/ At least you realize, hopefully, that you're surrounded by like-minded terrible people; unless you made a HUGE mistake, and then your friends just think your a ____.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M.

customer_reviews.title: Best Gift Ever
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend before we started dating over a year ago. Since then, I have been blessed to play it with him at a number of parties. This game NEVER gets old. It is nightmare fuel but also makes me laugh so hard every time. Great to play with friends. NOT KID FRIENDLY! Haha, make sure you look through the cards and get to know the game before deciding who you will play it with. There have been times we have had to filter some of the cards out, but it is still just has fun playing PG-PG13 level
customer_reviews.author: Chayse Felt

customer_reviews.title: Smashed my game in shipping! BaG?
customer_reviews.text: Ok , I played this game at a party...went over really well with my husband (lol). So for our 10 year wedding anniversary this was a great gift...except for Amazon for some reason decided they were going to send the game in a BAG?! Now I have a smashed box ...as a gift? Not cool ...cant return tomorrows the anniversary...so why the hell would they put it in a bag and not a box ...good lord knows they send everything in a box...so ya...would be nice if they would send a new box...but they wont...ugh....great game thu!
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Kartes

customer_reviews.title: LoL memorable night!
customer_reviews.text: If you are a prude, stay away!!!!!! I bought this game for a new years eve get together (Dec 2018, 6 of us) and it was a hit! I was hesitant but after seeing a few videos online I decided what the heck! Our age range was 25-45 and it was the most, cheapest and memorable fun I had in a while! There were times that the person reading the card couldn't even finish! Laughing so hard almost not breathing!!! We played it our own way, didn't read the directions but we stuck to the basic jist of how to play and it worked, prob even better! DEFINITELY NOT FOR CHILDREN OR BORING ADULTS LOL
customer_reviews.author: Army Girl 👮🏼‍♀️

customer_reviews.title: Very mature adult game
customer_reviews.text: Hilarious! Not for the easily offended. This is a very fun game but if you are someone who is easily offended then this game is not for you. Some of the question and answer combos can be downright vulgar, sexual, crude and offensive but that is some of what adds to the hilarity of the game. I thought that the instructions were easy to understand and the game is easy to play. I have had fun every time I have played.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Hilarious! Age appropriate only,
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh 🤣😂🤣😂🤣 I bought these for my 18 year old daughter for a Christmas gift and we played the game that evening and I haven't laughed so hard in years! I thought I had broke a rib the next day I hurt so much from laughing the night before. The games rules are easy to understand. This game is ONLY for adults and please do NOT play when children are present as it's VERY inappropriate for their young ears.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome...Great...Good...okay...meh
customer_reviews.text: Everyone knows this one (or should). While it was a great game there is a drawback: Once you know all the cards, it is a very boring game or you need to play it with people who have not yet played it which is not easy to find. I know there are expansion sets, but they are pretty expensive for a lot less cards. Also some of the cards are already dated so they are not fun with people who live in the internet age where only the last few memes matter.
customer_reviews.author: Jaytrade

customer_reviews.title: Great game! Don’t drink and play
customer_reviews.text: This game is hilarious, don’t buy it if you are easily offended. I did remove all cards to do with babies but that’s my preference. This is my second set as we play so often especially all summer long. And by all summer I mean while enjoying adult beverages and possibly forgetting the game outside as we all fell asleep and it got rained on and ruined :( fell asleep may be a slight deviation from the truth... in any case enjoy the game and don’t be butt hurt or you will be wasting your money.
customer_reviews.author: AmandaMCBryant

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: We actually already had this game but I got this game as a gift for someone who has game nights. It’s a game that everyone should have. I knew they would love it. The next day, after gifting it, I got a message that said “I haven’t laughed this hard in a long time! Everyone is dying of laughter over here!” Get this game if you’re thinking about it! It can even get those uptight people to break out of their shell!
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Great game for those who can handle it
customer_reviews.text: So for starters, there's people on here saying this game is horrible and filthy and blah blah blah... If you read the box it litterally says "a party game for horrible people" that being said if you don't have a very awful sense of humor it's not for you. Buuuuut if you're like my friends and I who have said sense of humor you will love this game it is super fun and you'll get a lot of laughs. My only problem with this game is the amount of cards and how many exspansion decks there are.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Very entertaining game for older teens and adults
customer_reviews.text: Older kids have a really good time playing this game. If you start getting the same cards, you can buy expansion packs from the manufacturer, and can purchase other third party expansion packs such as "crabs against humidity" . We have several sets of each. The game is a bit like Apples to Apples, but more entertaining for teens and adults. I don't suggest kids play this due to some of the content.
customer_reviews.author: pat

customer_reviews.title: All of the popular games are so similar now. Need something new
customer_reviews.text: After hearing so much hype about this type of game I found it to be repetitive and boring. It is like so many of the other games on the market right now that they're becoming tiresome and boring. Received expansion packs as gifts however just for some reason to not get into this game. I find this much like video games today they need something new and fresh it's just remakes of the same old thing
customer_reviews.author: Michael R

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for ADULT FUN.
customer_reviews.text: Best ADULT game night game. I had never played before, but had heard about it. Was skeptical upon receipt, but once we started playing... COULD NOT STOP LAUGHING! It was great completely politically INCORRECT ratchet fun! Even when we had to Google some words because we were clueless what they meant. We're a very intelligent bunch if I do say so myself, but there were a few words/terminology we were completely stumped by.
customer_reviews.author: SunShyne P.

customer_reviews.title: A little off-color and some stupid "filler" answer cards in there
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up for a family game night during the great lock down of 2020. Some of the cards are sexual in nature and I just skimmed the cards and removed them before we played with any of the younger teens. If you are easily offended, skip this game. BTW, the game NEEDS expansion packs pretty quickly. By just the second time we played, answers and questions started to feel repetitive.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great Social Experiment
customer_reviews.text: I played this for the first time over the weekend. I highly recommend playing with your friends, its a quick way to determine who of the bunch is the pervert, the sociopath, the depressed one, and who suffers from social anxiety. But if you add some drinking into the mix, you won't care that your friends are a bunch of perverted psychos and you can all shamelessly laugh at the messes your lives have become and bond over your common warped senses of humor each time you combine your cards!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Panda

customer_reviews.title: Game for Terrible Humans!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this horrible game! Had a neighborhood party where we brought together all walks of life to play this game. My husband was quite horrified I was inviting "fine, upstanding citizens in our community" over for this, and was worried it was going to be inappropriate. It ended up being an absolute blast, and the people you think are the most conservative, God-fearing individuals are secretly freaks. Definitely going to buy the expansion pack!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun for adults
customer_reviews.text: You'll see a new side of people when you play this game with them...and with others, you might not want to see them ever again. If you get offended by anything, this game is probably not for you. If you find humor in life, death, racism, misogyny, the holocaust, Coronavirus, homelessness, etc...well then you're probably a terrible person. And you should play this game.
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: What a game
customer_reviews.text: My family has played Apples to Apples for many years and now they are grown my daughter kept asking about Cards Against Humanity. She could not afford to buy so I decided to buy along with the green, red, and blue expansion packs. Oh my, I have never been as entertained or embarrassed as I have been playing this game. We laughed so hard for hours. I will never look at family gatherings (or my children) in the same manner again. Glad I bought the expansion packs with it, we would nearly go through the entire set in one gathering.
customer_reviews.author: Hockey Guy

customer_reviews.title: Cards against humanity
customer_reviews.text: Uhh have you been living under a rock? This is only one of the best party games you could ever play with a group of adults. Oh you think your friends are mature? As soon as you drop this box on the table, all your friends dark and twisted sides come out real quick. You think to yourself, “my friends are pretty mature and I think I know them pretty well.“ Bring this game out and you’ll see just how twisted your good friends Karen and Steve really are. In all seriousness, this game is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn B.

customer_reviews.title: For Horrible People Only...Like Me
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a fun adult party game for me & my friends for our monthly get togethers. Of course I read some reviews first and came across a couple that were saying how horrible the game is & its disgusting yadda, yadda, yadda & I thought, this game is perfect. My friends and I are horrible people so F it, I bought it & it was fun. I just wish there were more black cards.
customer_reviews.author: Lily is me

customer_reviews.title: Laughing so hard it hurts!
customer_reviews.text: Hours of hysterical laughter and great ADULT entertainment. Not a game you would want to play with Granny or at a Church Gathering. Great game for a night at home with friends. We laugh so hard playing this game that it hurts. I give Cards Against Humanity a SOLID 5 STARS. ☆☆☆☆☆
customer_reviews.author: Love4Music

customer_reviews.title: So funny I hurt myself laughing!
customer_reviews.text: As funny as a bunch of rabid squirrels! Oh, I'm loving this game more and more. If you have a dark sense of humor, And no limits, This game is for you. I've been playing it, And love it. The instruction manual is great too! Couldn't stop laughing. Hope you get it, If you have no limitations or can handle dark humor. I played it with my dad last night, And we both laughed so hard, We sprained our backs the next day. So sore, But it was well worth it. My dad nearly passed out laughing. The best that money can buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Lee

customer_reviews.title: Hilarious fun!  We laughed 'til we cried.
customer_reviews.text: Keep an open mind and be willing to be grossed out and laugh at very un-PC results. Even the instructions are funny. Easily modified to be super-easy to play. There were a couple of words we didn't even know (4 college educated, old people, so...), so just put that card back and draw another. I've played this with very different kinds of people and all enjoyed it immensely.
customer_reviews.author: lizzybethc

customer_reviews.title: It's alright, gets super old
customer_reviews.text: This is the kind of game that's cool and interesting the first few times you play it, but gets very dull once you've seen most of the cards. The expansions attempt to keep it new and fresh, but there are so many other party games I recommend over this one. I guess it's fun to play with people who have never played it, so you can see their reactions to the cards. But that's about it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ogleari

customer_reviews.title: Game was great, condition of cards not so much
customer_reviews.text: I’d heard a lot about this game and wanted to try it and it did make us laugh a lot. The 1 big complaint I have is that there was a weird reddish brownish substance/dried up liquid on about 5 of the cards. The box had clear wrap and all so I am not sure what happened prior to us receiving it but it was a very weird and concerning issue since we had no clue what it was. We did throw those cards out cleaned and washed up obviously.
customer_reviews.author: Monique

customer_reviews.title: Great, Hilarious, Outrageous Card Game
customer_reviews.text: Great card game for adults (definitely NOT for children or teens - I agree with the 17+ age they have on the side of the box). It's hilarious and outrageous - we can play this game for hours. This is the adult version of the card game 'Apples to Apples'. I do not recommend this to someone who is more "conservative" as it does get pretty morbid and raunchy. Otherwise, GET THIS GAME!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun & fabulous (explicit, though -- not for kids or churchies)
customer_reviews.text: Hilarious for adults (not for church groups); I went through the cards and took out the explicit ones to play it with my 13-year-old daughter and her friends and it was still very, very funny. Plus, this company does great work, like buying a piece of the border property and hiring a team of lawyers to keep it to slow down and botch up Drumpf's plans to build a wall. Yay for CAH!
customer_reviews.author: Monica W. Munn-Schreml

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: Fun game, but know your audience. 😂 My teen son gave this as a gift to my teen niece. They have played all the way through the decks three times in a week. The best part is that every game is different because of shuffling the cards. It is NOT a quiet game! It’s hilarious though. I can tell that we will need expansion packs!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Hilarious content, not for those easily offended
customer_reviews.text: We have played this game for a few years now. It's great for small gatherings, and we have even played across three generations of family (not sure if which was worse, learning how my teens thought, or my father). The content on the cards can be offensive, and if you are easily offended, or somewhat closed-minded, you may want to find an alternative. However, if you consider yourself open-minded, and maybe on the cruder side, then you will have fun with this. All-in-all, this game provides hours of entertainment and laughter.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in FL

customer_reviews.title: Really like this game!... not for sensitive ears or hearts.
customer_reviews.text: I love this game. I love the look on people's faces as they read some of the cards. This is always a good game to play with friends! Family... um, maybe depending on your type. If your parents or kids are ok to hear about "male parts" then you should be good to go. It's a great game but it had some brutal answers to the question cards, not for sensitive ears or hearts.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: I don't remember laughing so hard while playing this game!
customer_reviews.text: What a fun game! Definitely not for young ones but definitely for adults! I haven't laughed like I did while playing this game in a long long time. I think some of our friends were laughing so hard that they were crying. If you have a dinner party scheduled with adults and want to laugh your butt off, play Cards Against Humanity. There are also extension packs that can be purchased too-
customer_reviews.author: JetNoise

customer_reviews.title: Over-hyped.
customer_reviews.text: Meh. This is fun the first and maybe second time you play. After that, the rudeness of the game gets a little old.
customer_reviews.author: dotcompost

customer_reviews.title: Review written with 10 randomly selected cards.
customer_reviews.text: I was on "50mg of Zoloft daily""fading away into nothingness", while "my uber driver Pavel", with "one titty hanging out", offered up some "funky fresh rhymes" with his "inappropriate yodeling" to "wizard music" while showing me his "vigorous jazz hands" with a "sad handjob". "Exactly what you'd expect" All words between quotation marks were the exact phrases on the cards drawn.
customer_reviews.author: D.Schibel

customer_reviews.title: What fun!
customer_reviews.text: You need to have an open mind, and like to have hoots of fun and lots of laughter. These cards have topics and answers of "blue humor" but if you are aware of it going in, these are such fun. Definitely adult themed, we have laughed so hard, we've had to stop the game for emergency bathroom breaks and to catch out breath from laughing.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This game is fun. Friendships will be made and destroyed
customer_reviews.text: Write a review, what can I say. This game is fun. Friendships will be made and destroyed. You never know how twisted someones humor can be until it involves winning a game. Fun times. A cold beer and a few friends with this game is a good night. Even if you dont have friends you can still play this, trust me, someone please love me. It is so lonely and cold, but at least I have a fun game to look at.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Huth

customer_reviews.title: Good game with an improvement
customer_reviews.text: This is a very fun game that could give many hours of fun and there are technically alot possible combinations. Can be very funny and dark with the right combinations. The only downside I feel is that there are far too many "bad" white cards so sometimes you could get 3-4 rounds with boring answers. Some changes to some of the white cards would help possibly the expansions may remedy this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun!
customer_reviews.text: Played this with my family during last years New Year’s Eve. Never played it before. It was hilarious! Was not expecting it to be so fun. Seriously, instead of explaining it like some other reviews, trust me when I say that it is an awesome game to play with a group of people! You’ll be crying you’ll be laughing so hard. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Sliderguy

customer_reviews.title: Everyone is excited about the next family gathering so that we can have a lot more fun with it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a Christmas present and we had 8 players and WE HAD A BLAST. Everyone is excited about the next family gathering so that we can have a lot more fun with it. Super intense laughter. Fortunately we had some very "open-minded" players for naughty humor because it is very 18+ humor (in my opinion - although I don't think a lot of this is shocking to high school students anymore)
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Stephen Heilman

customer_reviews.title: Hilarious and inappropriate
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift and it was a huge hit. If you are unaware, it can be pretty...politically incorrect at times and may not be the best game for playing with your parents or grandparents. Definitely not for kids! That being said - it is hilarious and I'm looking forward to purchasing the additional cards.
customer_reviews.author: CheshireQat

customer_reviews.title: Love it but it needs to be updated
customer_reviews.text: The game is fun and I would highly recommend it to anyone BUT it does need to be updated. For example, I got an edition that still refers to Obama as president. Not a big deal since you can skip it but Trump is so much more fun to make fun of. Gotta update it!
customer_reviews.author: Steve H.

customer_reviews.title: Bigger blacker WHAT? oh right
customer_reviews.text: Ive wanted this game for a long time. Ive played with people online but its not the same. So I spent more than I should have to gather the entire collection. I only knew I needed a bigger box. I own the entirety of CAH except holiday packs. Theres still room for more so looks like ill be getting the husbands "hidden" credit card.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: nice game (its for people that whant to get a good time and don't mind a bit of colorfull words)
customer_reviews.text: I like the game, to be honest its not a easy game to play when inglish is not your firt language. I'm still waiting for a spanish original one, i now there are pdf but my laziness and like for the nice cards from a factory prevent me from printing one in spanish (i mean who can beat the quality of factory made cards . My only objection is that one of the cards was not cut correctly(1/600 its a minor thing and i buy and expancion so its ok)
customer_reviews.author: Mario

customer_reviews.title: Good Times will be Had by All!
customer_reviews.text: To be successful at this game you have to be a horrible person and I absolutely love this game! Fun for all ages....er....ummm....adults only please. Great party game...alcohol not included though. Guess that would be the only drawback. If they could squeeze a 6 pack of good craft beer into the box I'd give it an extra 6th star reserved just for absolutely perfect products only. Play this game. Many expansion packs available so you don't get bored with it!
customer_reviews.author: kixfan

customer_reviews.title: Extremely funny game of question and answer cards.  Definitely for upper teens and older
customer_reviews.text: Riotously funny card game. The players are dealt out white cards with responses. They then take turns reading the black cards, which have mainly one but up to three blanks on them, like the old Match Game from the seventies. The other players offer their best response and the reader of the black question card selects the funniest. The player giving that answer scores. The game itself is very simple, but there are endless combinations of questions and answers, and that is where the fun is.
customer_reviews.author: Musicals Freak

customer_reviews.title: Not your typical game for family night.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this game. Then again I've been told I have a crude sense of humor as well. I think you need it to play this game and get the most enjoyment out of it. A lot of the cards have sexual tones. Sometimes your choices of answers make it extremely vulgar. In other words, dont play with anyone you dont mind letting see how perverted you can be. ..... or just take those cards out.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: This game is our family favorite. It's a great game to relax and laugh. And it is very easy to play. Some of the cards can be raunchy at times (but), but this is a game for a mature audience. And the game doesn't end. There are many expansion packs you can purchase along the way so you don't get burnt out on the one box!!!
customer_reviews.author: A.Foll

product_meta.title: Cards Against Humanity
product_meta.description: Cards Against Humanity is a party game for horrible people. The game is simple. Each round, one player asks a question from a black card, and everyone else answers with their funniest white card. (This is the main game. Buy this first.)
feature_bullets: Cards Against Humanity is a party game for horrible people.
This is the main game. Buy this first.
Contains 500 white cards and 100 black cards for maximum replayability.
Includes a booklet of sensible game rules and preposterous alternate rules.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars60,888 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
